pli-tv-pvr1.9:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-pvr1.9:0.4: The section on “where it was laid down”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:0.5: 1. The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion
pli-tv-pvr1.9:1.1: “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of having sexual intercourse was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down? Whom is it about? What is it about? …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.1: “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of having sexual intercourse and that was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.6: Sudinna having sexual intercourse with his ex-wife.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.7: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.8: There is one rule. There are two additions to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.10: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere, or that applies in a particular place?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.12: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common, or a rule they do not have in common?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.13: That the monks and nuns have in common.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.14: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both Sanghas?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.16: “In which of the five ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it immersed and included?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.20: “To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.22: “To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.23: The class of offenses entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.24: “Through how many of the six kinds of origins of offenses does it originate?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.26: from body and mind, not from speech. …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:3.4: these were in India, the land named after the glorious rose apple.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:5.1: These great beings of great wisdom,
pli-tv-pvr1.9:5.2: Knowers of the Monastic Law and skilled in the path,
pli-tv-pvr1.9:5.3: Proclaimed the Collection of Monastic Law
pli-tv-pvr1.9:5.4: On the island of Sri Lanka.”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.1: “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of stealing and that was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.6: Dhaniya stealing timber from the king.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.7: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in three ways:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.9: from body and mind, not from speech; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.10: from speech and mind, not from body; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.1: “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of intentionally killing a human being—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.7: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in three ways:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.9: from body and mind, not from speech; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.10: from speech and mind, not from body; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.1: “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of claiming a non-existent, unreal superhuman quality —where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.4: The monks from the banks of the Vaggumudā.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.6: Those monks praising one another’s superhuman qualities to householders.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.7: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in three ways:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.9: from body and mind, not from speech; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.10: from speech and mind, not from body; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:9.1: The four offenses entailing expulsion are finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:10.0: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension, etc.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:10.1: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of emitting semen by means of effort and that was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened On. Where was it laid down? Whom is it about? What is it about? …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.1: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of emitting semen by means of effort was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.7: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.8: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.10: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere, or that applies in a particular place?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.12: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common, or a rule they do not have in common?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.13: A rule they do not have in common.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.14: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both Sanghas?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.16: “In which of the five ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it immersed and included?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.20: “To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.22: “To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.23: The class of offenses entailing suspension.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.24: “Through how many of the six kinds of origins of offenses does it originate?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.26: from body and mind, not from speech. …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:12.4: these were in India, the land named after the glorious rose apple.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:14.1: These mighty beings of great wisdom,
pli-tv-pvr1.9:14.2: Knowers of the Monastic Law and skilled in the path;
pli-tv-pvr1.9:14.3: Proclaimed the Collection of Monastic Law
pli-tv-pvr1.9:14.4: On the island of Sri Lanka.”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:15.1: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of making physical contact with a woman—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:15.6: Udāyī making physical contact with a woman.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:15.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in one way:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:15.9: from body and mind, not from speech. …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.1: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of speaking indecently to a woman—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.6: Udāyī speaking indecently to a woman.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in three ways:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.9: from body and mind, not from speech; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.10: from speech and mind, not from body; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:17.1: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of encouraging a woman to satisfy one’s own desires—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:17.2: It was laid own in Sāvatthī…
pli-tv-pvr1.9:17.6: Udāyī encouraging a woman to satisfy his own desires.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:17.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in three ways: …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.1: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of acting as a matchmaker—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.7: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in six ways:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.9: from body, not from speech or mind; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.10: from speech, not from body or mind; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.11: from body and speech, not from mind; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.12: from body and mind, not from speech; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.13: from speech and mind, not from body; or
pli-tv-pvr1.9:19.1: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of having a hut built by means of begging—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:19.6: Those monks having huts made by means of begging.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:19.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in six ways: …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:20.1: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of having a large dwelling built—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:20.6: Channa having a tree that served as a shrine felled to clear a site for a dwelling.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:20.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in six ways: …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:21.1: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:21.6: Those monks groundlessly charging Venerable Dabba the Mallian with an offense entailing expulsion.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:21.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in six ways: …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:22.1: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:22.6: Those monks charging Venerable Dabba the Mallian with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:22.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in three ways: …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:23.1: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of a monk not stopping to pursue schism in the Sangha when pressed up to three times—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:23.6: Devadatta pursuing schism in a united Sangha.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:23.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in one way:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:24.1: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of monks not stopping to side with one who is pursuing schism in the Sangha when pressed up to three times—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:24.6: Those monks siding with and supported Devadatta’s pursuit of schism in the Sangha.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:24.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in one way:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:25.1: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of a monk not stopping to be difficult to correct when pressed up to three times—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:25.6: Channa making himself incorrigible when legitimately spoken to by the monks.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:25.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in one way:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:26.1: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of a monk not stopping to be a corrupter of families when pressed up to three times—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:26.6: Those monks, when the Sangha did a legal procedure of banishment against them, slandering the monks as acting out of desire, ill will, confusion, and fear.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:26.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in one way:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.1: “The offense of wrong conduct that is a result of, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water—where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.4: The monks from the group of six.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.6: Those monks defecating, urinating, and spitting in water.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.7: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.8: Of the six kinds of origins of offenses, it originates in one way:
pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.9: from body and mind, not from speech. …
pli-tv-pvr1.9:28.1: The first section on “where it was laid down” is finished.
